result.execSummary:
The defendant Katherine A Solomon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Sentence credit - TBD.  
09/22/15 SENTENCE CREDIT OF 30 DAYS WAS GRANTED IF IMPOSED.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to fine.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Menomonee Falls Police Department.  Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

Victim Impact Panel:  11-18-2015.  Defendant to serve 30 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to atend Victim Impact Panel.

1 YEAR OF DAY REPORT CENTER, CONSECUTIVE TO CONDITION TIME.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Katherine A Solomon in court, in custody, with Attorney John Thomas Bayer.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant.  Attorney Bayer withdraws motion and requests to go to plea and sentencing.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #3.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #3.  Counts #1 & 2 are dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Bayer makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #3:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

210  DAYS HUBER   (credit to be determined-Attorney Bayer to file by 9/7/15) 

*D/L REVOCATION: 33 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 33 months.

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR DRC  (see below)

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed/sign releases
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*1 YEAR of Day Report Center consecutive to condition time. 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $30.50 (to be paid as a condition of probation - to be forward to Menomonee Falls Police Department);

Victim Impact Panel on:  11/18/15. Defendant to serve 30 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH

FINE:  $1,494.00 (to be paid out of cash bail posted - remainder to be returned to poster)  NOTE:  $3,000.00 of bail money to be returned to Mr. Bryan Fossum and $1,000.00 cash bail to be returned to Jason Waters and then remainder to be applied to fine and then remainder returned to poster. 

CONDITION TIME:  60 DAYS,   NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH - DEFENDANT ALREADY IN CUSTODY
